pgTitle: List of works by Joseph Blackburn (painter)

rows.text: Portrait of Mrs. Susannah Ulrich (?) (c. 1750), oil

Portrait of General Francis Jones (c. 1752), oil

Los Angeles County Museum of Art
Subject: husband of Frances (Fanny) Jones. IAP 71930564, IAP 80970102, and possibly IAP 80970103

Subject: husband of Patience Stowe. IAP 80970096

Subjects: Anne Butterfield (1722-1797; wife of Colonel Henry Tucker [1713-1787]; Elizabeth Tucker (1747-1830); Nathaniel Tucker (1750-1807). IAP 80960071
Portrait of Gurdon Saltonstall (c. 1753-1763), oil on canvas

Subject: Brigadier General Gurdon Saltonstall (1708-1785); son of colonial Connecticut Governor Gurdon Saltonstall (1666-1724) and Elizabeth Rosewell (1679-1710); husband of Rebecca Winthrop (1711-1776). IAP 07300020
Portrait of Miss Deborah Bascombe, oil
Portrait of Mrs. John Harvey (c. 1753), oil
Portrait of Mrs. Alexander Grant, oil on canvas
Portrait of Captain John Brown (c. 1754), oil on canvas

Subject: lived 1717-1803; husband of Lucy Winthrop (1721-1776). IAP 71481248 and IAP 80044318
Portrait of Mrs. George Jaffrey (c. 1754), oil
Subject: Lucy Winthrop (1721-1776); wife of George Jaffery (1717-1803). IAP 71481249 and IAP 80044319
Portrait of Mary Sylvester, oil on canvas, a pastoral portrait
Portrait of Mrs. David Chesebrough, oil on canvas
Portrait of Andrew Faneuil Phillips, oil on canvas
Subject: lived 1729-1775; son of Gillam Phillips (1695-1770) and Mary Faneuil (1708-1780). IAP 22280220 and IAP 80960052
Portrait of Andrew Oliver Jr., oil on canvas
Portrait of Mrs. Andrew Oliver Jr., oil on canvas
Subject: Mary Lynde (1733–1807); wife of Andrew Oliver (1731-1799; m. 1752). IAP 80960048
Portrait of Colonel Benjamin Pollard (c. 1755), oil on canvas
(sometimes listed as copy after John Smibert's original of 1730)
Portrait of Mrs. Chambers Russell (c. 1755), oil
Subject: lived 1716-1762; wife of Chambers Russell (1713-1767). IAP 80960061 and possibly IAP 20440078
Portrait of Gillam Phillips, oil on canvas
Subject: lived 1695-1770; husband of Mary Faneuil (1708-1780); father of Andrew Faneuil Phillips (1729-1775) and Ann Faneuil Phillips (1736- c. 1770). IAP 80960053
Portrait of Mrs. Gillam Phillips, oil on canvas
Subject: Marie Faneuil (1708-1780); wife of Gillam Phillips (1695-1770); mother of Andrew Faneuil Phillips (1729-1775) and Ann Faneuil Phillips (1736- c. 1770). IAP 80960054

Subjects: Isaac Winslow (1707-1777; one of Boston’s mercantile elite); his wife, Lucy Waldo (1724-1768; m. 1747); elder daughter, Lucy Winslow (1749-1770); child in mother's lap, Hannah Winslow (1755-1819). Setting: Scenery of idealized garden with swan pond behind elder daughter alludes to family’s prosperity. IAP 85520007 and IAP 82110940
Portrait of James Otis, Jr., oil
28 ⅝ × 23 ½ in. (72.7 × 59.7cm.) [also reported as 29 ½ × 25 ½ in. (74.9 × 64.8cm.)]
Portrait of Mrs. James Otis (c. 1755), oil
Portrait of John Erving, Jr., oil
Subject: lived 1728-1816; husband of Maria Catherine Shirley (1729-1816). IAP 80960032
Portrait of Mrs. John Erving, Jr., oil
Portrait of Miss Ann Phillips, oil on canvas
Subject: Ann Faneuil Phillips (1736- c. 1770); daughter of Gillam Phillips (1695-1770) and Mary Faneuil (1708-1780). IAP 80960051
Portrait of Mrs. Epes Sargent (c. 1775), oil
Subject: Catharine Winthrop/Katherine Winthrop Browne (1711-1781). IAP 80970116
Portrait of Mrs. George Bethune, oil on cavas

Subject: Mary Faneuil (1734-1797); daughter of Benjamin Faneuil (one of first paper manufacturers in Massachusetts); niece of Peter Faneuil (provided funds for Boston's public market and meeting house); wife of George Bethune (m. 1754, Boston); mother of George, Susan (Mrs. Edmond Dunkin), Penelope (Mrs. English), Jane (Mrs. William Hunt), and Ann (Mrs. Lovell). IAP 22930027
Portrait of Mrs. Louis Boucher (c. 1755), oil
Portrait of Mrs. Samuel Curwen, oil
Subject: Abigail Russell (1725-1793); wife of Samuel Curwen (1715-1802; m. 1750). IAP 80960027
Portrait of Mrs. Thomas Flucker (c. 1755), oil on canvas
Subject: Hannah Waldo (1726-1785); wife of Thomas Flucker (1719-1783; m. 1750); sister of Lucy Waldo (1724-1768). IAP 17860012
Portrait of Reverend Daniel Greenleaf, oil on canvas
Subject: also known as Dr. Daniel Greenleaf (1679-1763); father of William Greenleaf (1725-1803). IAP 80970113 and IAP 82110320
Portrait of a Military Officer, oil on canvas
Portrait of Benjamin Ellery III (c. 1756), oil on canvas
Portrait of Benjamin Green, oil on canvas
Portrait of Colonel Henry Babcock, oil
Portrait of Elizabeth Naden, oil on canvas

Subject: lived c. 1739-1808; daughter of Martha Naden Mortier; stepdaughter of Major Abraham Mortier; wife of John Appy (secretary to general and judge advocate of British Army in North America; m. 1757); later wife of Goldbrow Banyar, Sr. (m. 1767). IAP 36360936

Subject: Mary Brown (1728-1807); wife of Hon. William Greenleaf (1725-1803). IAP 80960041
